t: Zephaniah 3
The Wickedness of Jerusalem
Woe*pn to her who is rebellious and polluted, To*ld the oppressing city!
She*ld has not obeyed His*i voice, She*ld has not received correction; She*ld has not trusted in the Lord,*s She*ld has not drawn near to her God.
Her*ln princes in her midst are*i roaring lions; Her*ld judges are*i evening wolves That*ld leave not a bone till morning.
Her*ld prophets are insolent, treacherous people; Her*ld priests have polluted the sanctuary, They*ld have done violence to the law.
The*ld Lord*s is*i righteous in her midst, He*ld will do no unrighteousness. Every*ld morning He brings His justice to light; He*ld never fails, But*ld the unjust knows no shame.
“I*ln have cut off nations, Their*ld fortresses are devastated; I*ld have made their streets desolate, With*ld none passing by. Their*ld cities are destroyed; There*ild is*i no one, no inhabitant.

I*ld said, ‘Surely you will fear Me, You*ld will receive instruction’— So*ld that her dwelling would not be cut off, Despite*ild everything for which I punished her. But*ld they rose early and corrupted all their deeds.
A Faithful Remnant

“Therefore*pn wait for Me,” says the Lord,*s “Until*ld the day I rise up for plunder; My*ld determination is*i to gather the nations To*ld My assembly of kingdoms, To*ld pour on them My indignation, All*ld My fierce anger; All*ld the earth shall be devoured With*ld the fire of My jealousy.
“For*ld then I will restore to the peoples a pure language, That*ld they all may call on the name of the Lord,*s To*ld serve Him with one accord.
From*ld beyond the rivers of Ethiopia My*ld worshipers, The*ld daughter of My dispersed ones, Shall*ld bring My offering.

In*ld that day you shall not be shamed for any of your deeds In*ld which you transgress against Me; For*ld then I will take away from your midst Those*ld who rejoice in your pride, And*ld you shall no longer be haughty In*ld My holy mountain.
I*ld will leave in your midst A*ld meek and humble people, And*ld they shall trust in the name of the Lord.*s

The*ld remnant of Israel shall do no unrighteousness And*ld speak no lies, Nor*ld shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth; For*ld they shall feed their*i flocks and lie down, And*ld no one shall make them*i afraid.”
Joy in God’s Faithfulness
Sing,*pn O daughter of Zion! Shout,*ld O Israel! Be*ld glad and rejoice with all your*i heart, O*ld daughter of Jerusalem!
The*ld Lord*s has taken away your judgments, He*ld has cast out your enemy. The*ld King of Israel, the Lord,*s is*i in your midst; You*ld shall see disaster no more.
In*ln that day it shall be said to Jerusalem: “Do*ld not fear; Zion,*ld let not your hands be weak.
The*ld Lord*s your God in your midst, The*ld Mighty One, will save; He*ld will rejoice over you with gladness, He*ld will quiet you*i with His love, He*ld will rejoice over you with singing.”
“I*ln will gather those who sorrow over the appointed assembly, Who*ld are among you, To*ild whom*i its reproach is*i a burden.

Behold,*ld at that time I*ld will deal with all who afflict you; I*ld will save the lame, And*ld gather those who were driven out; I*ld will appoint them for praise and fame In*ld every land where they were put to shame.

At*ld that time I will bring you back, Even*ld at the time I gather you; For*ld I will give you fame and praise Among*ld all the peoples of the earth, When*ld I return your captives before your eyes,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
